page.title: 11Kirk Bramwith Parish
page.content: Kirk Bramwith,original Domesday ref : {In Branuuith 5 sokemen and 2 bordars {with 1 plough.Wood pasture 1 quarenten {long,and 1 broad.}The name suggests Saxon/Danish origin,villages of Braithwaite and Bramwith show Danish influence_houses bordering single village street,strip of land behind.{ {South Bramwith}oldest buildings, Bramwith Hall, Bridge Farm-(note limestone). {Braithwaite}2 schools 1846,1902,now private houses.Pear Tree Farm 1725, Wesleyan Chapel 1877- now art studio.{ {Kirk Bramwith}- Rose Cottage and Manor House show limestone indicating similar age to church (13th.C.). A number of cottages in parish are built of hand-made brick. Most roofs are pan-tiled.
